text: Psalm 4
Safety in Yahweh

For the \add music\add* director; with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 4 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
When I call, answer me, O God of my righteousness.\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Or “vindication” \f*
In trouble ⸤deliver me⸥.\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Literally “make wide for me” \f*
Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.
O sons of man, how long will my honor\f + \fr 4:2 \ft Or “glory” \f* be a disgrace?
\add How long\add* will you love vanity?
\add How long\add* will you seek lies?\f + \fr 4:2 \ft Or “falsehood” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
But know that Yahweh has set apart\f + \fr 4:3 \ft Or “treated specially” \f* for himself \add the\add* faithful one.\f + \fr 4:3 \ft Or “pious, godly one” \f*
Yahweh hears when I call to him.
Be disturbed but do not sin.
Commune in your heart\f + \fr 4:4 \ft That is, “think it over” \f* on your bed and be silent. \qs Selah\qs*
Offer correct sacrifices,\f + \fr 4:5 \ft Or “right sacrifices” \f*
and ⸤trust in⸥\f + \fr 4:5 \ft Literally “trust to” \f* Yahweh.
Many are saying, “Who will show us \add something\add* good?”
Lift up over\f + \fr 4:6 \ft Or “upon” \f* us the light of your face, O Yahweh.
You have put gladness in my heart
more than ⸤when⸥\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Literally “the time of” \f* their grain and their wine abound.
In peace I will lie down and sleep ⸤at once⸥,\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “together” \f*
for you alone, O Yahweh, make me dwell safely.
